docs.snippet: The reconversion of the Moore-McCormack liner Brazil has been completed and the ship is scheduled to make her final test runs on Thursday, E.J. Crofoot, president of the Atlantic Basin Iron Works, in Brooklyn, announced yesterday. Following...
docs.lead_paragraph: The reconversion of the Moore-McCormack liner Brazil has been completed and the ship is scheduled to make her final test runs on Thursday, E.J. Crofoot, president of the Atlantic Basin Iron Works, in Brooklyn, announced yesterday. Following completion of the sea trials the Brazil will be turned over to the Maritime Commission and subsequently returned to Moore-McCormack Lines.
docs.abstract: Final test runs set; reconversion described; Amer Merchant Marine joint com meeting set

headline.main: FINAL TEST RUNS SET FOR THE BRAZIL; Reconversion Now Complete at a Cost of Approximately $9,000,000, Official Says

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 4 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly decided today to establish a subcommittee to bring in a proposal "for a provisional regime for Palestine."
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 4 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly decided today to establish a subcommittee to bring in a proposal "for a provisional regime for Palestine."
docs.abstract: Abdullah message to UN urges halting alleged butchery by Zionists; seen as intervention threat

headline.main: U.N. GROUP VOTES PALESTINE SURVEY FOR INTERIM RULE; Political Committee 33 to 7 for Setting Up Unit to Plan a Provisional Regime TACTICAL GAIN FOR BRITAIN Only 3 in Body of 12 Are Firm for Partition -- King Abdullah Warns of Invasion U.N. GROUP VOTES PALESTINE SURVEY

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ABOARD S.S. BRAZIL, at Sea, May 6 -- The 20,000-gross-ton liner Brazil, completely rebuilt and refurnished for the luxury New York-South American trade, put to sea early yesterday for her first commercial voyage in more than six years.
docs.lead_paragraph: ABOARD S.S. BRAZIL, at Sea, May 6 -- The 20,000-gross-ton liner Brazil, completely rebuilt and refurnished for the luxury New York-South American trade, put to sea early yesterday for her first commercial voyage in more than six years.

headline.main: LINER BRAZIL OFF FOR TEST VOYAGE; Completely Rebuilt, Refurnished Vessel Carries Several Hundred Guests on Run

byline.original: By GEORGE HORNEBy Radiotelephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: In its first concrete action to meet the immediate crisis in Palestine, the United Nations General Assembly asked Britain yesterday to appoint a special Municipal Commissioner for Jerusalem.
docs.lead_paragraph: In its first concrete action to meet the immediate crisis in Palestine, the United Nations General Assembly asked Britain yesterday to appoint a special Municipal Commissioner for Jerusalem.

headline.main: U.N. ASSEMBLY ASKS BRITAIN TO APPOINT A JERUSALEM MAYOR; Votes 35 to 0, 17 Abstaining, for Naming of a Neutral Acceptable to 2 Sides OTHER MEASURES PUSHED Political Committee Ordered to Give Urgent Attention to Protection of Holy City U.N. ASSEMBLY ASKS NAMING OF MAYOR

docs.snippet: FROM the beginning of the war Commodore Harwood's special care and duty had been to cover British shipping off the River Plate and Rio de Janeiro. He was convinced that sooner or later the Graf Spee would come toward the Plate, where the richest...
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM the beginning of the war Commodore Harwood's special care and duty had been to cover British shipping off the River Plate and Rio de Janeiro. He was convinced that sooner or later the Graf Spee would come toward the Plate, where the richest prizes were offered to her. He had carefully thought out the tactics which he would adopt in an encounter.
docs.abstract: Commodore Harwood tactics in action off River Plate against Graf Spee; Graf Spee scuttling by Capt Langsdorff; Langsdorff suicide; Amer nations protest to GB, France and Ger against violation of Amer security zone

headline.main: By Winston Churchill: The Second World War; INSTALLMENT 22 -- THE ACTION OFF THE RIVER PLATE Volume I -- The Gathering Storm Commodore Harwood's Squadron Off the Plate -- His Foresight and Fortune -- Collision on Dec. 13 -- Langsdorff's Mistake -- The Exeter Disabled -- Retreat of the German Pocket Battleship -- Pursuit by Ajax and Achilles -- The Spee Takes Refuge in Montevideo -- My Letter of Dec. 17 to the Prime Minister. Book II -- The Twilight War British Concentration on Montevideo -- Langsdorff's Orders From the Fuehrer -- Scuttling of the Spee -- Langsdorff's Suicide -- End of the First Surface Challenge to British Commerce -- The Altmark -- The Exeter -- Effects of the Action Off the Plate -- My Telegram to President Roosevelt. 'THUS ENDED FIRST SURFACE CHALLENGE TO BRITISH TRADE'

docs.snippet: Riding with the Allen T. Simmons' entry in the $19,725 Remsen Handicap at Jamaica yesterday was $100,545 of the $201,726 win pool. It was a safe ride. The Okron radio executive's Eternal World won it with hardly any trouble and his Swords Town cut in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Riding with the Allen T. Simmons' entry in the $19,725 Remsen Handicap at Jamaica yesterday was $100,545 of the $201,726 win pool. It was a safe ride. The Okron radio executive's Eternal World won it with hardly any trouble and his Swords Town cut in for a sliver of the purse by finishing fourth.

headline.main: Eternal World Takes $19,725 Remsen Handicap by Two Lengths at Jamaica; -10 CHOICE FIRST WITH ATKINSON UP
